snippet: Two new books, one by a group of medical ethicists and another by the feminist critic Susan Gubar, offer searing accounts of confronting a lethal disease.
abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews books Malignant: Medical Ethicists Confront Cancer, edited by Rebecca Dresser, and Memoir of a Debulked Woman: Enduring Ovarian Cancer by Susan Gubar.
lead_paragraph: Two new books, one by a group of medical ethicists and another by the feminist critic Susan Gubar, offer searing accounts of confronting a lethal disease.

headline.main: Assumptions and Attitudes Don’t Survive Cancer
headline.print_headline: Assumptions and Attitudes Don’t Survive Cancer
